meanings.definition: A person who believes that knowledge is primarily derived from representations of external objects.
meanings.sent1: The representationalists in the class always preferred visual aids to understand concepts.
meanings.sent2: Many representationalists argue that our perception of reality is shaped by our mental representations.
meanings.sent3: The representationalists at the art gallery were convinced that the abstract painting was actually a representation of a famous landmark.
meanings.sent4: She compared the representationalists to artists, who create their own versions of reality through their work.
meanings.sent5: The concept of representationalists can be confusing, but it essentially means relying on images to gain knowledge.

meanings.definition: Those who adhere to the theory that mental states represent external objects or states of affairs.
meanings.sent1: As representationalists, they believe that our thoughts mirror the world around us.
meanings.sent2: The representationalists in psychology often study how our perceptions reflect the external environment.
meanings.sent3: The representationalists at the conference humorously compared their theories to a mirror reflecting reality.
meanings.sent4: In a way, representationalists act as bridges between our minds and the external world.
meanings.sent5: The idea of representationalists can be seen as a puzzle piece connecting our thoughts to the outside world.
